intro: Edwardsia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Goodeniaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy environments. They are characterized by their striking blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. Edwardsia species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their unique appearance and resilience.
